name: Meerkat
description: A small carnivore with a slender body, small ears, and a pointed snout. It is overall sandy brown with darker transverse stripes on its back, an ochre underside, and dark patches around the eyes.
image_alt: Meerkat pups, photo: Tomáš Adamec, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 25–35 cm, tail length 17.5–25 cm, shoulder height 15 cm, weight 0.6–1 kg
attractions: If you were looking for the embodiment of curiosity in the African savanna, you’d pick the meerkat. This small carnivore from the mongoose family inhabits grassy savannas and arid shrubby semi-deserts. They always live in colonies, resting together in underground burrows at night, huddling for warmth in the cool mornings, and staying in constant contact during the day.
